meta.description: Check if you are eligible for the confirmation of your Polish citizenship by descent and obtain the EUROPEAN PASSPORT!

thankyou_screens.title: We provide legal assistance exclusively to people of *Polish* descent

Nie udzielamy porad ani pomocy prawnej osobom, które wyemigrowały z Polski po roku 1989

*Pozdrawiamy z Kraju :)*

Children did not emigrate on their own! :) Please reload the test and *start from an ADULT ancestor* e.i. the father of the one you started previously.

[In case your ancestor really was a minor (teenager) and emigrated on his own please mark "ADULT" when asked about his age.]
Unfortunately if your ancestors emigrated from Poland back in the XIX century *you are not eligible*
Unfortunately if your ancestors gave up their Polish citizenship in the past *you are not eligible*

Unfortunately public service (and {{field:68641469d460049a}}{{field:31e469b8f84742a1}} is such) in a foreign country before 19.01.1951 caused Polish citizenship loss so... *you do not have a case*.

Yo can of course try the test again if you are not sure or think that the profession was different...

Unfortunately public service (and {{field:d802b0b1f0aeab89}}{{field:13ff308851f3e387}} is such) in a foreign country before 19.01.1951 caused Polish citizenship loss so... *you do not have a case*.

You can of course try the test again if you are not sure or think that the profession was different...

THANK YOU

Unfortunately if the 1st generation was born before 19.01.1901 + naturalized before 19.01.1951 and the next generation was born after 19.01.1933 *you are not eligible*. 

Detailed proper legal explanation is a bit more complicated. 

Please do check if the dates of birth and naturalization are indeed correct and if you are not sure...

THANK YOU

Unfortunately if the 1st generation was born before 19.01.1901 + naturalized before 19.01.1951 and the next generation was was still a minor child at the time of naturalization *you are not eligible*. 

Detailed proper legal explanation is a bit more complicated. 

Please do check if the dates of birth and naturalization are indeed correct and if you are not sure...

THANK YOU 

Please contact us by email at *info@polishcitizenship.pl* and describe your case in details

Please also read this important info very relevant for your case: https://polishcitizenship.pl/law/#circularno18

THANK YOU 


Till January 19th, 1951 only men could pass Polish citizenship to their children and in the family everyone had the citizenship of the *father* and/or *husband*. Thus if your key ancestor was a woman the case is more complicated

Please contact us by email at *info@polishcitizenship.pl* and describe your case in details...

THANK YOU 

If your ancestor was woman that emigrated before January 19th, 1951 as a minor child and her father was not Polish the case is complicated and most probably you are not eligible...

Please contact us by email at *info@polishcitizenship.pl* and describe your case in details.

THANK YOU 

If the 2nd generation was an *illegitimate child* and the key Polish ancestor was his/her father there is no case because by birth illegitimate children got the citizenship of a MOTHER. 

You could possibly go through your female ancestor but only if she was also Polish of course...

THANK YOU 

It seems like your ancestors are not of Polish descent so you are not eligible
We will now analyze your test and get back to you with an *eligibility assessment*. Please kindly allow up to 5 business days due to the high number of inquiries.
We will now analyze* *your test and get back to you with an *eligibility assessment*. Please kindly allow up to 5 business days due to the high number of inquiries.
All done! Thanks for your time.

welcome_screens.title:
POLISH CITIZENSHIP TEST
                                                             
We have prepared detailed and comprehensive test. It consists of questions you need to answer and information to know about the process. Please secure ab. 10 - 30 mins of your time to *complete this one properly*. You may need to consult with your family to correctly answer some of the questions.

fields.title: Are you *Polish* or Polish-Jewish by descent?

properties.description: *IMPORTANT:* Please note that if your family is Ukrainian, Belorussian, Lithuanian, or German by ethnicity and emigrated before 1951 - you do not qualify*.*

fields.title: ABOUT YOUR ANCESTORS NATIONALITY

properties.description: Polish citizenship law that changed on January 19th, 1951. questions the *nationality*. So we need to check it deeper. It is crucial answering the following two questions correctly!

fields.title: What is the nationality of your family? They are ethnically:
How would you classify your ancestors by their religious beliefs?
Please confirm that you gave *true* answers to the above questions about nationality.
What is your email address?

properties.description: Please do pay attention to provide *correct and valid email address* otherwise, we will not be able to communicate with you! :)

fields.title: BEFORE YOU DO THE TEST PLEASE READ THIS INFO!

properties.description: It is pointless to do the test if you have no idea about the procedure, documents, costs, and other relevant issues. We strongly urge you to *read the info below carefully*.

fields.title:
To obtain a Polish European passport, you must first be officially recognized by Polish authorities as a Polish citizen. And to obtain Polish citizenship, you must go through a procedure called: 

THE CONFIRMATION OF THE POSSESSION OF POLISH CITIZENSHIP

properties.description:
*It is quite a complex and in many cases complicated process and has nothing to do with some old passport renewal at a Polish consulate. It takes time and effort to accomplish. If you are seriously considering applying for Polish citizenship now or in the future please do read this carefully!*



*1. ELIGIBILITY* 

Legislation on Polish citizenship is based on the right of blood (_ius sanguinis_). This means that a child of a Polish citizen legally acquires Polish citizenship by birth. The place of birth is not important. Until January 19, 1951, children born of wedlock (married couple) acquired the citizenship of the father, and children born out of wedlock acquired the citizenship of the mother. Thus, many people who are descendants of Polish immigrants and today living in many countries in the world have the right to Polish citizenship and can obtain their Polish European passport. In the procedure of the confirmation of the possession of Polish citizenship by descent we must prove 3 things: that your ancestors indeed were Polish citizens, that they did not lose it and that you are the descendant. Checking one's eligibility is in fact about *the dates* of birth, marriage, emigration, naturalization and army service of the relevant ancestors and family members. 

===> Checking and confirming the eligibility is always the very first thing to do.



*2. DOCUMENTS*

Every application for the confirmation of the possession of Polish citizenship must be based on documents. These must be first of all *Polish documents* meanning issued in Poland, by Polish authorities and after 1900. Other foreign documents are of course useful for establishing relevant facts and confirming personal data but are not enough as a proof of one's possession of Polish citizenship! The most important are the documents that prove Polish citizenship beyond any doubt: Polish passports or IDs, military records, residence and voting lists and also birth and marriage certificates (although civil acts alone are not enough!).

===> The possession of the relevant Polish documents is a pre-condition to file the application. 



*3. ARCHIVES* 

If you do not have any old original Polish documents of your ancestors you must obtain them. Nothing can be done without relevant Polish documents! Please do check with your family... If not the next step after checking and confirming the eligibility will be the archives search in Poland or in other countries like Ukraine or Belarus that were part of Poland before WWII.

===> Archives search must be done by *professional researchers*.



*4. REPRESENTATION*

The amendments implemented into the Polish legislation in 2009 necessitate the appointment of an agent for delivery (proxy) *based in Poland* for applicants who do not reside in Poland. In practice, this means that a person applying for Polish citizenship who permanently resides outside Poland cannot conduct procedures entirely via a Polish consulate. You may file an application via a consulate, but any further procedure will be conducted only through an agent that lives (has a permanent address) in Poland.

===> Legal representation in Poland is *a must* not a choice. 



*5. CONSULATE*

It is no longer possible to confirm Polish citizenship entirely via a Polish consulate in your country of residence. According to the amendments implemented in 2009, a person applying for the confirmation of Polish citizenship who does not permanently reside in Poland should establish, as a minimum, an agent for delivery in Poland. This means that it is possible to apply for citizenship at the consulate (submit the documents only!), but the authorities in Warsaw processing the case will not directly contact a person residing abroad, not even via a Polish consulate. The basic aim of this amendment was to relieve Polish diplomatic missions from handling citizenship issues, the influx of which exceeded any expectations after 2004.

===> If you contact any Polish consulate in the world they will confirm that you must appoint a *representative based in Poland*. 



6. INVESTMENT

The overall investment that includes all (not just our fees) what you will pay until you get your Polish European passport consists of quite few things: archival searches, translations, legal advising fee, and case processing fee, You will also pay a fee for certifying copies of documents in your country and a Polish passport fee at a Polish Consulate. With our representation this total cost should not exceed *1'500 EUR per applicant*. (Complicated and complex cases may of course cost more and take longer.) This price has been calculated based on hundreds of cases from many countries that we have processed over the last 20 years.

===> Second passport is an investment rather than a cost. 



7. TIMING

The procedure for the confirmation of Polish citizenship by birth is complex, as Polish laws governing the citizenship have been amended countless times since 1920. The time span is affected by many factors: time for searching, collecting and submitting relevant documents, translations and administrative procedures conducted by the relevant Polish Head of Province (Wojewoda). In most cases, the procedure lasts *from 12 to 36 months*.




*8. CITIZENSHIP* 
 
Most countries where the descendants of Polish immigrants live today, such as the United Kingdom, United States, Canada, Australia, Brazil, Argentina and Israel allow so called* dual citizenship*. Polish law dictates, however, that anyone who holds Polish citizenship is considered by Polish authorities exclusively as a Polish citizen irrespective of citizenship in another country. People in possession of a Polish passport have all the same rights as any other European citizen in all the EU countries. There is no obligatory army service in Poland anymore. Following the European rules of no-double-taxation, you will not pay taxes to the Polish government if you work or do business in another European country and do not reside in Poland permanently. 



*9. PASSPORT*

Polish passport is first of all the Polish one that you get because you are of Polish descent, then it is a second passport and of course it is a *European passport* that gives freedom in all EU member states. 



*10. ADVISE* 

After almost 20 years of advising in the matters of Polish citizenship we can honestly say this: the procedure of the confirmation of the possession of Polish citizenship by descent is not one of the things you do on your own. You do need help: good legal assistance that we will certainly provide.

===> Hiring a good legal representative in Poland will save you money and a lot of time!



*11. TEST*

The following test was prepared by experts and all the info and questions in it are there for a reason. As you will see it is mostly about the* dates* of: birth, marriage, naturalization etc. The most important date that the 'eligibility calculation' is based on is *January 19th, 1951* when the Polish citizenship law changed.

===> Do your best to answer all the questions properly!

fields.title: *Have you read the info above?*
ABOUT YOUR ANCESTORS ORIGINS

properties.description: For many reasons it is *very important* to know from what part of Poland your ancestors come from as the borders of the country changed after WWII and vast of its pre-war territory today belongs to *Ukraine*, Belarus or Lithuania.

fields.title: Are you able to *point the place* where your ancestor/s come from on Google maps?
Is this place in *today's*?
Do you know to point its *exact location* on Google maps?
Please paste the link from Google maps:
Any additional information about your ancestors origins?
FIRST BASIC QUESTIONS

properties.description: Based on the answers to these first 3 basic questions you will be redirected to the next part of test relevant for you...* Thus please answer as precisely and correctly as possible!*

fields.title: *In what country your ancestor/s settled after emigration from Poland?*
* When did your ancestor/s emigrate from Poland?*

Please note that cases of emigration from *before 1920* (before Poland regained independence) are more complex and difficult to prove. Documents proving permanent residency on the territories that after 1920 became part of the Polish State are crucial to prove the case!

===> Please click on the 'CONTACT US' button below for further detailed case analyzes...

If your ancestor/s emigrated *between 1900 and 1951* the case needs full detailed analyzes and you must make an effort to answer all the following questions precisely so we will be able to give you the true answer whether you are eligible or not!

If your ancestors emigrated from Poland *after 19.01.1951* you are most probably eligible as after that date one could lose his Polish citizenship only if he gave it up officially out of his own will. In short: you have an easier case :) 

===> Click on NEXT STEP button below to be properly redirected to the next stage
*Did you or your ancestor* (parent or grandparent)* ever officially resign from from Polish citizenship?*

properties.description:
This would have to be done through a Polish Consulate and official decision had to be issued and received! 'Resignation' towards any foreign government in order to naturalize (get citizenship) in the new country had no legal value from the Polish law point of view.

===> You must provide a clear answer so there is no "I do not know" option here. Please do *consult with your family* if you are not sure...

fields.title: *Who is your Polish ancestor for you?*

properties.description: By your Polish ancestor we mean the one that was a Polish citizen and emigrated as an *adult*. If both great-grandparents or grandparents or parents were Polish please choose the *male* ancestor. Meaning that if for example your both grandparents we Polish you shall choose the *grandfather* not the grandmother!

fields.title: Was your {{field:eac0070423d9287b}}'s husband also Polish?
ABOUT YOUR POLISH (female) ANCESTOR

properties.description: By your Polish ancestor we mean the one that was a Polish citizen and emigrated as an adult (e.i. she was over 18 when left Poland). Take your time and consult with your family to answer these questions correctly as ===> *these answers will determine your eligibility*!

fields.title:
Please CONFIRM that you are starting the test from your *ADULT* ancestor that was over 18 years old at the time of emigration.

We have noticed that too many people start the test from a grandfather or a grandmother that was just a child when emigrated and the child by the law is always dependent on its parent.
*Please confirm who she is for you?*
What is your {{field:4b7f7b5eff887702}}'s full name?

properties.description: Please try to write it in proper *Polish spelling* if you know how of course

fields.title: In what *year* did she leave Poland?
*When was your {{field:4b7f7b5eff887702}} born?*
Was she an* ADULT* (over 18 years old) when arrived in {{field:957608c9922df075}}?

properties.description: *If she was a minor child you must start with her FATHER or mother so you will be redirected to the previous section to chose the ADULT ancestor...*

fields.title: Do you know the exact date of birth?

properties.description: If you do not know the exact date please just try to provide the *year* of birth like: 00/00/1925

fields.title: Please confirm the date?
*Do you have her birth certificate?*

properties.description: If your relevant Polish ancestor got married before 1951 the *possession of the marriage certificate is ===> absolutely crucial!*

Please upload the copy...

fields.title: DEEPER CASE ANALYSES

properties.description: Because your 1st generation ancestor was born before January 19, *1901*, what means that he turned 50 years old before the citizenship law changed on January 19, *1951*, the case needs deeper analyzes. We need to make some *calculations* so please answer the following questions about the dates as precisely as possible!

fields.title: Please confirm that the 1st generation was born BEFORE January 19, *1901*
Do you know his exact date of birth (year at least)?

properties.description: Best based on Polish or other official documents!

fields.title: What is his birth date (year at least)?
Please confirm the date
When was his child (the next generation) born?
Do you know the exact date of birth (year at least)?
What is his date of birth?
Please confirm the date
Please confirm that your {{field:6329131151b0aa6b}} naturalized in {{field:957608c9922df075}} before January 19, *1951*
What is the exact date of naturalization (year at least)?
Please confirm the date

KEY QUESTION No.1: 

Did your {{field:6329131151b0aa6b}} turned *50* years old BEFORE his child (the 2nd generation) turned *18* years old?

properties.description:
EXAMPLE 1: if your great-grandfather was born in 1890 and his son (your grandfather) was born in 1925 means that the great-grandfather turned 50 in: 1890 + 50 = *1940* and his son turned 18 in: 1925 + 18 = *1943*. So it this case you should answer "*Yes*".

EXAMPLE 2: If your great-grandfather was born in 1890 and his son (your grandfather) in 1920 means that the great-grandfather turns 50 in: 1890 + 50 = *1940* and his son turns 18 in: 1920 + 18 = *1938 *so in this case you should answer "*No*"

fields.title:
KEY QUESTION No.2: 

On the day of the naturalization was your {{field:6329131151b0aa6b}} (the 1st generation)* over 50* years old?

KEY QUESTION No.3: 

On the date of your {{field:6329131151b0aa6b}}'s (the 1st generation) naturalization in {{field:957608c9922df075}} was her/his child (the next generation) an *ADULT* (18+ years old) or a *MINOR* (under 18 years old)?

properties.description:
EXAMPLE 1: If your great-grandfather naturalized in *1940* and his son/daughter (your grandfather/grandmother) was born in *1925* means that the the child was *15* years old. So it this case you should answer "*MINOR*".

EXAMPLE 2: If your great-grandfather naturalized in *1940* and his son/daughter (your grandfather/grandmother) was born in *1920* means that the child was *20* years old. So it this case you should answer "*ADULT*"

fields.title: ABOUT YOURSELF
Who is your Polish parent?

properties.description: Please choose the relevant parent in the ancestry line you started the test with.

fields.title: Are you a *legitimate* child?

properties.description: Legitimate child is one born after his parents got married and legally recognized by the father. The marriage of the parents had to be a civil marriage and proven by a civil marriage certificate.

fields.title: Were you parents married at the time of your birth?

DOCUMENTS, DOCUMENTS, DOCUMENTS

properties.description: Each and every case of Polish citizenship confirmation must be proven by relevant *Polish* and other *documents*. Please tell us if you have any and if so please do UPLOAD THEIR COPIES.

fields.title: *Do you have any old original Polish documents of your family?*

properties.description: By 'Polish documents' we mean documents issued in Poland, by Polish authorities and after 1900. Read more about needed documents here: https://polishcitizenship.pl/documents/

fields.title: What kind of *Polish* documents do you have?
Are you 100% sure that *you actually do possess* these original old Polish documents???

properties.description: The possession of Polish documents is very important to the next stage of the process so please provide a TRUE answer!

properties.description: Please write Your surname entirely in *CAPITAL* letters. Like this ==> KOWALSKI, not Kowalski.
